title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
content: Atomic Habits is about the compound effect of small changes. Clear argues that 1% improvements daily lead to remarkable results over time. The book focuses on four laws: Make it obvious, make it attractive, make it easy, and make it satisfying.
keyTakeaways: Habits are the compound interest of self-improvement
Environment shapes behavior more than motivation
The Two-Minute Rule: downscale habits until they take 2 minutes

title: Deep Work
author: Cal Newport
content: Deep Work explores the value of focused, distraction-free work in an increasingly fragmented world. Newport argues that the ability to perform deep work is becoming rare and valuable. He provides strategies for cultivating this skill.
keyTakeaways: Deep work produces rare and valuable outcomes
Schedule every minute of your day
Quit social media (or be very selective)

title: The Psychology of Money
author: Morgan Housel
content: This book explores how people think about money and why financial decisions are often emotional rather than logical. Housel shares 19 short stories illustrating ways people think about money.
keyTakeaways: Wealth is what you don't see - it's the money not spent
Enough is realizing when to stop taking risks
Compounding is the most powerful force in finance
Save money without a specific goal - flexibility has value

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
author: Stephen Covey
content: Covey presents an approach to being effective in attaining goals by aligning oneself to what he calls 'true north' principles based on a character ethic.
keyTakeaways: Be proactive - take responsibility for your life
Begin with the end in mind
Put first things first - prioritize effectively
Seek first to understand, then to be understood
